label: The Economist Democracy Index
description: Measures the state of democracy based on electoral process, civil liberties, functioning of government, political participation, and political culture. Published by the Economist Group.

label: Gender Inequality Index
description: The Gender Inequality Index reflects gender-based disadvantage in three dimensions â€“ reproductive health, empowerment and the labour market.

label: Control of Corruption Index
description: Reflects perceptions of the extent to which public power is exercised for private gain, including petty and grand forms of corruption.

label: Press Freedom Index
description: Evaluates the level of freedom available to journalists based on pluralism, media independence, environment, self-censorship, legislation, and infrastructure.

label: GDP
description: Gross Domestic Product - the total monetary value of all goods and services produced within a country's borders in a specific time period.

label: Annual GDP Growth
description: Annual percentage growth rate of GDP at market prices based on constant local currency. Shows how fast the economy is expanding or contracting.

label: GDP per Capita
description: GDP divided by midyear population. Provides a per-person measure of economic output, useful for comparing living standards between countries.

label: GDP per Capita (PPP)
description: GDP per capita adjusted for Purchasing Power Parity. Accounts for price differences between countries, providing a more accurate comparison of living standards.

label: Debt to GDP Ratio
description: The ratio of a country's public debt to its GDP. Indicates the country's ability to pay back its debt without incurring further debt.

label: Inflation
description: Annual percentage change in consumer price index. Measures how quickly prices for goods and services are rising and purchasing power is declining.

label: Unemployment Rate
description: Share of the labor force that is without work but available and seeking employment. A key indicator of labor market health.

label: Gini Coefficient
description: Measures income inequality within a country. Shows how evenly wealth is distributed among the population.

label: Population
description: Total number of people residing in a country. Based on de facto definition counting all residents regardless of legal status or citizenship.

label: Fertility Rate
description: Total fertility rate - the average number of children a woman would have over her lifetime. Rate of 2.1 is considered replacement level.

label: Median Age
description: The age that divides the population into two numerically equal groups - half are younger, half are older. Indicates the overall age structure.

label: Urbanization Rate
description: Percentage of total population living in urban areas. Reflects the degree of industrialization and development patterns of a country.

label: Life Expectancy
description: Average number of years a newborn would live if current mortality patterns were to remain constant. Key indicator of overall health and development.

label: Homicide Rate
description: Intentional homicides per 100,000 people. Includes murder and manslaughter but excludes deaths from war. Indicates public safety and social stability.

label: Self-reported life satisfaction
description: Based on the Cantril Self-Anchoring Scale where respondents rate their current life on a ladder from 0 (worst) to 10 (best possible life).

label: Human Development Index
description: The Human Development Index (HDI) is a summary measure of key dimensions of human development: a long and healthylife, a good education, and a decent standard of living.
